channel.title: I don't even know... help?
channel.description:
So the public chat between the admin and mod crown is messed up, and Im stuck..
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/2u5uovm.png[/img]
any ideas?

item.title: I don't even know... help?
item.dc:creator: @yesimanub yesimanub
item.description:
@yesimanub wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:7, topic:520763”]that code is for the drawing + offset. that has nothing to do with the chat.

public chat; look for

I know what you’re saying, but I already went through all that and nothing was wrong with it… don’t believe me take a look.

case 1 is rights 1

case 1: pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpoken, 2, "@cr1@" + "<col=423112>"+loyaR(myPlayer.skill)+"</col>" + myPlayer.name); break;

Read full topic

item.title: I don't even know... help?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

that code is for the drawing + offset. that has nothing to do with the chat.

public chat; look for

pushMessage(myPlayer.textSpokenif you can’t figure it out after that, then just quit.

Read full topic

item.title: I don't even know... help?
item.dc:creator: @yesimanub yesimanub
item.description:
@yesimanub wrote:

yea, I already went through all the public methods and such, still couldn’t find anything fishy…

if((chatType == 1 || chatType == 2) && (chatType == 1 || publicChatMode == 0 || publicChatMode == 1 && isFriendOrSelf(s1))) { if (chatTypeView == 1 || chatTypeView == 0) { if(yPos > 0 && yPos < 110) { int xPos = 19; switch(byte0) { case 1: modIcons[1].drawSprite(xPos, yPos - 12); xPos += 14; break; case 2: modIcons[2].drawSprite(xPos, yPos - 12); xPos += 14; break; case 3: modIcons[2].drawSprite(xPos, yPos - 12); xPos += 14; break; case 4: modIcons[3].drawSprite(xPos, yPos - 12); xPos += 14; break; case 5: modIcons[4].drawSprite(xPos, yPos - 12); xPos += 14; break; }

Read full topic

item.title: I don't even know... help?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

if your client is refactored (should be considering you know the crowns are @cr#@.) the method for building the chat are pretty easy to read and understand

Read full topic

item.title: I don't even know... help?
item.dc:creator: @yesimanub yesimanub
item.description:
@yesimanub wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:2, topic:520763”]@cr#@ are what displays the crowns in the client (search the client class for)

@cr0@ @cr1@ @cr2@ etc

read the code and you will understand where it goes, it’s pretty easy to read

now, if your client is non-renamed, then idk what to tell you[/quote]
I already knew the declaring of the crowns, etc it’s just I don’t know where it could be causing this.
Yes I have went through every cr’s and modicons’s that are being declared.

Read full topic
